solution_line_template: If Darren bought {darren_boxes} boxes of crackers, each containing {crackers_per_box} crackers, the total number of crackers that Darren bought is {crackers_per_box}*{darren_boxes}=<<{crackers_per_box}*{darren_boxes}={darren_total_crackers}>>{darren_total_crackers}
Twice as many boxes of crackers as Darren bought is {multiplier_twice}*{darren_boxes}=<<{multiplier_twice}*{darren_boxes}={twice_darren_boxes}>>{twice_darren_boxes}

If Calvin bought one box less than twice as many boxes of crackers as Darren, then Calvin bought {twice_darren_boxes}-{calvin_less_than_twice}=<<{twice_darren_boxes}-{calvin_less_than_twice}={calvin_boxes}>>{calvin_boxes} boxes of crackers.
The total number of crackers that Calvin bought is {calvin_boxes}*{crackers_per_box}=<<{calvin_boxes}*{crackers_per_box}={calvin_total_crackers}>>{calvin_total_crackers}
Together, Darren and Clavin bought {calvin_total_crackers}+{darren_total_crackers}=<<{calvin_total_crackers}+{darren_total_crackers}={total_crackers_altogether}>>{total_crackers_altogether} crackers.
